yes!! i have seen those three films that you are talking about. i have copies of those. i highly recommend that you watch and collect those aforementioned films. 



Kenshi Zey <paganelfshimmer@...> wrote:
greetings everyone!

i was going through this website that i download films from and i came across these 'samurai' films from 'the criterion collection', like: samurai I -musashi miyamoto ( http://us.imdb.com/Title?0047444 ); samurai 2 - duel at ichijoji temple ( http://us.imdb.com/Title?0048579 ); samurai III - duel at ganryu island ( http://us.imdb.com/Title?0049710 ); samurai reincarnation ( http://us.imdb.com/Title?0082699) and samurai champloo ( http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0423731/ ). the latter two are not from 'the criterion collection' i suppose.

the thing i want to ask is, has anybody seen any of these films and would you recommend them? perhaps not as a learning tool, yet to gain some visual insight into the life of the samurai. thanks in advance...
